name: Roman
subtitle: Discord Bot Developer · Web Apps · APIs
heroLine: Started coding at 14. Two years later, I'm building Discord systems that keep communities safe, organized, and fun — and learning the CS fundamentals behind it.
bio: I’m Roman — a 16-year-old developer obsessed with building reliable software. I love the intersection of community + engineering: bots that don’t crash, dashboards that make sense, and systems with real permission design. My dream is to make it into Computer Engineering and keep leveling up how I build.
nowBuilding: A next-gen moderation bot + dashboard stack (clean UX, safe permissions, fast performance).

timeline.title: Started coding
timeline.desc: Built small scripts, learned the basics, got addicted to solving problems.

timeline.title: First bots shipped
timeline.desc: Commands, embeds, moderation tools — learning what breaks in real servers.

timeline.title: Production systems
timeline.desc: Rate-limit safety, logging, DB design, and clean architecture.

timeline.title: Computer Engineering
timeline.desc: Deep CS fundamentals + building bigger systems. (The goal.)

projects.name: Sentinel
projects.desc: Anti-raid + moderation suite with fast audit logs, smart filters, and safe automation.

caseStudy.overview: A moderation system built to stay calm during chaos: raids, spam waves, and rule-breaking — without nuking innocent users.
caseStudy.problem: Growing servers get hit with spam and raids. Human moderation can’t react fast enough, and basic automod setups often create false positives or miss coordinated attacks.
caseStudy.solution: Sentinel uses a layered pipeline: fast filters → cooldowns → escalation rules → safe actions. Every action is logged, permission-gated, and designed for recovery.
architecture: Audit log writer (structured logs for staff review)
Cache for hot state (rate-limit + raid detection)
highlights: Raid detection using join velocity + heuristics
results: Faster response to spam waves with fewer false positives (compared to a simple keyword filter).
Cleaner staff workflow: logs show what happened and why an action triggered.

projects.name: Pulse
projects.desc: Logging + analytics pipeline with real-time events, search, and dashboards.

caseStudy.overview: A real-time event stream for Discord systems so you can see what’s happening live.
caseStudy.problem: Bots are hard to debug when everything is buried in console logs.
results: Makes debugging and moderation reviews way easier.

projects.name: Echo
projects.desc: Media bot with queue controls, filters, and clean UX (no lag, no drama).

caseStudy.overview: A music/media experience focused on stability and smooth controls.
caseStudy.problem: Music bots become unstable when queues, voice, and rate-limits collide.
caseStudy.solution: Clean queue state, predictable controls, and stable audio routing.
results: Less lag, fewer glitches, better UX.

services.title: Discord Bots
services.desc: Moderation, utility, leveling, tickets, custom workflows.

services.title: Dashboards
services.desc: OAuth2 login, settings panels, server analytics, logs.

services.title: Automation
services.desc: Webhooks, integrations, clean systems that save time.

seo.description: Roman is a 16-year-old developer building Discord bots and web apps. Projects, case studies, and contact.
